Clearly shocked at the site of others, the white-bearded gnome grabs their staff with surprising agility and points it toward you:  "{@i Aha! Who be ye, and how in the hells did ye sneak up on old Snuffbottom?}"

After his initial shock and after regarding the adventurers with no small amount of suspicion, Fargrim will share his story willingly — though he will be reluctant to share his vision (he will do so with a successful {@b {@dc 16} Charisma (Persuasion)} check). Fargrim will agree to aid the adventurers, and discuss his experiences within The Living Tower.
The rest of the room can be described as follows:

This room appears to have been the last stand of three humanoids, for their skeletons litter the ground. One lies underneath the shattered door, clearly having attempted to unsuccessfully prevent something from entering the room.

In one corner, a skeleton has been blasted apart. Scorch marks have been burned into the stone, and a rotten shattered staff has been nearly reduced to ash. The skeleton's skull grins up at you 5 feet from the rest of its shattered body.

The third skeleton is covered in a tattered cloak - the result of Fargrim Snuffbottom, the cantankerous gnome demonstrating a surprising softness and respect to the deceased, even though he knew them not at all.

Debris has been piled against one wall. Snuffbottom has not yet been investigated, but it appears to be a portion of a merchant ship's cargo - stained parchments and books have been salvaged no doubt by these unfortunate souls who found their way into here.

If a character spends 10 minutes investigating the debris and makes a successful {@b {@dc 12} Intelligence (Investigation)} check, they will find a ship's log — an unremarkable voyage overall, yet the final entries are concerning. These pages tell of the ship being attacked in the night by strange creatures with many limbs like an octopus but also with humanoid features, dragging sailors into the depths. Several sailors, named Edgardo, Wescott, Beaman, Timon, Jan, Ilja, Reve, and captain Tizian navigated the ship closer to shore, and abandoned ship to avoid the creatures.

The sailors were sucked into an underground cavern system, with enough pockets of air to stay alive. After what they thought was two days and numerous times at the edge of drowning, they emerged into what they thought was an ancient ruin.

Within the ruin, the sailors make note of a massive, slimy eel-like creature communicating with them in their head (telepathically). The creature slowly toyed with the sailors, one by one isolating them and enslaving them, presumably by magic.

One by one the sailors fell, until only captain Tizian, Jan, and ship's mage, Reve, remained. Presumably, Reve's final casting slew the trio, for the five other sailors were transformed into the {@b servitors} found on this floor.

entries.name: 8. Cecaelia's Shrine

entries: The water in this room has become stagnant and foul, its texture slimy and foul upon your exposed skin. Debris has clearly been used to block several passages out of the room, and in the center of the room lies a crudely carved stone statue of an octopus, tentacles splayed outward.

Darting about the rooms are about a dozen small figures, propelling themselves through the slimy water with ease, chattering amongst themselves in an odd tongue. One word you can make out seems vaguely familiar - Acythylass. Upon seeing you they dart forward, daggers in hand.
The stagnant water in this room is vile, and any saving throws made when touching any mucus within the room are made with disadvantage.

The debris blocking the two passageways leading to Acythylass and Greylythoon's lairs can be cleared, requiring 10 minutes of toil and a successful {@b {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics)} check. Doing so causes the current to rush through the tunnel behind and into the chambers beyond. characters must succeed on a {@b {@dc 16} Strength} saving throw to not be caught in the current and swept away.

entries.name: Cecaelia
entries: Cecaelia are small, repulsive sea creatures that dwell in shallow waters or in coral reefs. While they typically shy away from interacting with surface dwellers, they are potentially dangerous to lone fishermen who stray into their waters, but will generally shy away from larger groups and open confrontation.

Cecaelia have multiple limbs: four tentacles with suckers used for grasping prey or opponents, and four "arms" - primitive appendages ending in grasping, clawed hands that are used to grasp prey or even weapons salvaged from shipwrecks. When startled or threatened, cecaelia release a cloud of ink and propel themselves rapidly through the watery depths away from whatever danger lurks about.

{@b Primitive Culture.} Cecaelia may at times band together in large, but dispersed, colonies of up to several hundred individuals. They are a primitive folk, with limited language skills that most surface dwellers can't understand; their language punctuated with clicks, whistles, and squeals that carry for long distances through salt water. They are wary of outsiders, and may attack if they sense the slightest threat.

{@b Salvagers.} Cecaelia prizes shiny baubles and trinkets above all, and will salvage treasure for ships that met a watery fate upon their reefs or in the shallows. Such treasure hoards are stored in underwater caves, and fiercely guarded by members of the colony. Trade is an unknown concept to the cecaelia, and despite having no apparent understanding of mathematics they know the identity and location of each individual piece of treasure they have salvaged. Some members of the colony may adorn themselves with trinkets, thought to reflect a higher social standing in the colony, or even bear daggers in their clawed appendages.
The Cecaelia are a primitive species by most measures, yet unlike other races they have remained unchanged for the millennia I have observed them.  〄

entries.name: 9. Breeding Grounds
entries: Greylythoon spends most of their time in this room, lounging about and waiting for the cecaelia to bring them their next meal. Until Acythylass' offspring have grown larger, they remain somewhat vulnerable to large predators of the deep.

In this small underwater room, to your surprise you see what appears to be a nest containing several oddly shaped eggs covered in a thick layer of mucus. Within a second nest sits a salamander-like creature with claws and fangs that, while small, would look threatening if the monstrosity was bigger.

An androgynous voice reaches out and touches your mind, speaking in slurping tones that remind you of a tavern drunkard attempting to tell you a tale while simultaneously consuming stew or ale:  "{@i Flimsy little creatures, you dare to enter my chamber? Come then, I could use a meal...}"

entries.name: 10. Acythylass' Lair
entries: Unlike Greylythoon, who is physically weaker (yet possesses all the intelligence and memories of their parent), Acythylass has no hesitation in venturing forth to attack the flimsy humanoids that Karthax has sent to their lair. Thus they may be found in any submerged or half-submerged room, toying with the adventurers, or attempting to enslave them while they are alone.

The water in this room is 20 feet deep. In the middle of the northern wall at the bottom of the room is a 10-foot by 10-foot underground cavern, which is pulling water out of this room and into the underground cavern.
The current in this room is stronger than anywhere else, and pulls you relentlessly toward the northern wall. Several heavy crates bob on the water's surface.

A massive salamander-like creature, much larger than the offspring seen previously, gleans at you with a gaping maw while touching your mind with a deep, slurping voice:  "{@i Few of your ilk make their way to me. I will enjoy tasting your thoughts. Soon you will remember nothing, and think of nothing but serving me...}"

At the start of a creature's turn, it must succeed on a {@b {@dc 15} Strength} saving throw or be pulled 5 feet toward the underground cavern (Area 11). If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is pulled 10 feet. A creature with a swimming speed automatically succeeds on the save. A creature without a swimming speed can use its action to make a {@b {@dc 17} Strength (Athletics)} check to swim 10 feet away from the underground cavern.
You think you're finished? Silly mortal, this is merely the beginning...  〄

entries.name: 11. Underground Cavern
entries: If a creature is pulled near the middle of the northern wall and then 15 feet under the water's surface, it is sucked into the underground cavern. If this happens, read or paraphrase:
The relentless pull of the current eventually saps your strength. With nothing left to prevent it, your body is sucked through a narrow opening by the swift flowing water.
You can see nothing and hear only the rush of water pounding in your ears. Tossed about mercilessly by the river, your head smashes into a rock and you know nothing more.

entries.name: Completing this Floor
entries: The adventurers do not necessarily have to defeat Acythylass to escape The Living Tower via the underground river flowing away from The Living Tower in Acythylass' lair. Eventually this is the route out, and the disease caused by the creature's mucus will allow the adventurers to survive.

Vague memories of swimming and the taste of blood and salt are but a blur within your mind — that and the crash of lightning and relentless pounding of waves. You can't recall how many times you regain something resembling consciousness only for it to slip away once again.

Finally, at long last, some calm descends over you. A gull's cry far overhead stirs you, and the sun — a warm and welcome feeling from your time within a crumbling tower (or was that but a dream?) stirs you. The gentle lapping of waves tickles your feet.

Opening your eyes slowly, you see a cloudless, brilliant blue sky overhead. The gull calls again, and you roll your head to one side. You are laying on a pristine white sand beach overlooked by steep chalk bluffs. Weak from your exertions, you take a few moments to bask in the sunlight, even doze in peace for just a few moments.

You awaken once again to a shadow looming over you. Squinting, you can make out a humanoid face. the figure softly murmurs to you:  "{@i Welcome, lost soul. Be at ease, you are safe and among those who would welcome you.}"

As your eyes adjust, you behold a sight that defies the kind, soft words murmured to you — that of a face decayed, one eye milky white and unseeing. Only a few teeth remain in a smile that is no doubt meant as kindly, but from your experiences, such creatures would sooner tear into your flesh than aid you.
Panic sets in, yet the figure simply rests a gentle hand upon your brow and softly whispers:  "{@i Rest, lost soul. Answers will come when you are ready.}"
Blissful sleep takes you, the first true rest that you have experienced in quite some time...

I'd lost count how many wayward souls have ended up in my tower over the years. Always nice to reminisce...  〄

entries.name: Appendix II - Quips & Tips
entries: Below is the Karthax's Quips table: a d100 table containing phases, riddles, taunts, omens, and even possibly a few words of wisdom that can be used to help Karthax narrate while players are exploring The Living Tower. The intention with Karthax's Quips table is for Game Masters to roll on it and then read aloud the phrase indicated. While a quip might not be relevant to the floor the party is currently exploring, they have been created to be general enough so that they will foreshadow what is to come, or serve as a quick reminder of what was already experienced.

The idea for this table is to add a dynamic nature to Karthax and make this omniscient being feel "alive", but not everything needs to be so serious. Some of the responses, narrated when the party is in a sticky situation, can be used to great comic effect. A GM might wish to read through the tables before running Karthax: The Living Tower; picking and choosing phrases in advance.

The general outline of the d100 Karthax's Quips table is for each group of 10 quips to refer to their numbered floor. For example, taunts 11-19 refer to the 1st Floor, 20-29 refer to the 2nd Floor, and so-on. Taunts 01-09 are general, and refer to the tower itself, or are simply Karthax's general thoughts. The table has been organized in this manner so GMs can easily pick taunts for a current or upcoming floor if they wish. In addition to the d100 Karthax's Quips table, there are nine d6 Karthax's Tips tables, one for each floor of The Living Tower. These d6 tables are specific to their corresponding floor, and can be used while a party is exploring that particular floor.

entries.name: Narrating Karthax's Quips & Tips
entries: Given the plethora of non-player characters and their conflicting motives within The Living Tower, the easiest way to utilize the Karthax's Taunts table is to give Karthax their own "voice" and "personality", which is consistent throughout the adventure. This can be as simple as having a unique accent for Karthax, or perhaps Karthax represents someone in your campaign that the players will recognize and is now embodied by the tower. Either way, being consistent in your delivery of Karthax's quips will let your players get onboard with the sarcastic nature and have a bit of fun conversing with Karthax as they explore The Living Tower.

entries.name: When should a GM roll on the Table?

items: If the party is talking among themselves, while trying to solve a puzzle
If a character references Karthax directly
If there is an awkward silence.
While a player is deciding what to do on their turn in combat

entries.name: When should a GM avoid rolling on the Table?

items: When an important NPC is talking with the party
Right at the beginning or end of combat

entries.name: Karthax's Quips
entries.caption: Karthax's Quips
rows: Welcome to my tower, mortals.
It is truly an honor to have you explore my tower! I just hope you do better than the last party...
Many sights to behold in my tower, both grotesque and exquisite alike!
The wasteland rhino is certainly an unsightly creature, wouldn't you say? I can't believe one was rampaging in my portal room!
Free will is an illusion, woven into the fabric of this realm. All must bow before the entropy of the universe.
Perhaps there is more to you than I thought. Not so weak after all...
Why was that one paladin wearing chainmail? Because it's holey armor! (Karthax laughs)
Trust no one in this tower. Any and all might be friend or foe, though some might be both or neither.
There is no rest for any in my tower. Be always on thy guard....
Ah, Bloodseeker... probably misguided in his views, but who am I to say?
Concealed treasures I have no use for. Burden yourselves with them, should you choose, but greed can be a powerful enemy.
Sanguarite gemstones... Amusing what chaos greed over a simple pretty rock can sow.
Concealed treasures I have no use for. Burden yourselves with them, should you choose, but greed can be a powerful enemy.
Small creatures can harbor large secrets.
A six-limbed creature that eats gems you say? Simply delightful!
Alas, I see only one end for you, and that is the abyssal darkness of death. It stalks you slowly, relentlessly within these walls.
Squabbles among brethren... Don't any of you realize it's all meaningless?
Honor can be found even among thieves and treasure hunters. Don't judge others too hastily!
Mortals are so fragile, lick your wounds, curs, for greater challenges await.
I once witnessed Krul'Thunk get in a slapping match with themself.
Tried some of the delicious ogre's brew yet? If not, you're in for a treat!
Red liquid in a glass bottle? I wonder what it does?
Can ogres really be this dense?
Pah. The stench of those filthy ogres will never leave the stone of my tower.
Knowledge may be found in the least likely places, mortals. Search thy surroundings thoroughly...
You behave as sheep do, only they have more sense than it appears you have.
Dwarves are as rigid as the stone through which they delve. Easily manipulated, most of them.
Who knew an ettin could write legibly? It must have been his good half.
Even the dullest of minds can stumble across powerful magics. You might learn a thing or two here....
Spiders... Why is it *always* spiders?
Beware worshippers of hideous beasts—not necessarily the beasts themselves.
A hive mind...the next evolution of the mortal realm? I should hope not.
Curious minds must be tempered with wisdom lest they succumb to forbidden temptations.
Wizards who lust for power are an endless source of entertainment for me.
That purple goo is almost rhythmic.
Twins are so interesting to me—so alike, yet so different. Mine was quite the opposite of me.
The infestation of my tower must be cleansed! Go forth, weaklings, and see if you can eliminate this scourge from my walls!
If Sryytyl's floor was empty, I wouldn't miss it.
Alyryne, what have you become?
Unending life might seem a gift, but a curse it can be for those entombed.
Ware the dead, their motives differ not at all from the living.
The secrets of death, even one such as I hesitate to delve into.
When the tombs of the dead are grander than the homes of the living one might question the motives of so-called rulers.
Cunning are the stonemasons of yore, who constructed this mausoleum where I constructed this tower.
A simple die roll might change the fate of the mortal realm.
Those who seek power best be on their guard, for jealousy can cause the most loyal subject to waver.
Poor Raquel, he has been fighting those skeletons for some time. Won't someone help him?
The Wizen are ever so loyal... or are they?
Imagine the wealth one could amass if they lived forever!
Demons embody the worst of chaos, for their wanton destruction shall be the end of all living things if left unchecked.
Mortals are easily seduced by the power of greater beings - demonkind being the most manipulative of all.
Pain is a tool of those who seek submission and subjugation. It should not be so.
Pity the rambling fool, but trust them not one bit for their mind is shattered with horrors beyond comprehension.
Seeking balance in the realm? Arioch certainly has a unique perspective.
You will see the cost of making a deal with the devil.
The only truth in this realm is chaos. Law and order are but constructs of control.
Even the darkest shadow must flee before the dawn.
Forbidden knowledge in skin-bound tomes is best left untouched, for its corruption might spread unchecked.
A copper band with the power of teleportation? Amazing what demons can create!
One of three is mad with righteous fury, one lusts for power and death, the third is a curious enigma. Choose thy poison carefully.
Beware sifting sands and dangerous idols.
Round and round and round they go, whom they slay, no one can know.
The dead are always restless, but only the very mighty - or foolish - would seek to bend them to their will.
Piousness and rules blind one to the truth.
Unpredictability is so amusing. One can never quite predict the motives of the insane.
Does a shroud of illusion simply cover one's own imperfection?
How different can three siblings possibly be?
A mask that changes your appearance in the eyes of another? Isn't that the point?
Law.....an excuse for those who wish to maintain power for themselves.
The Jarl loves sagas. Maybe you should tell him one of your own?
Odd that Hjálmŷr keeps a raging fire pit in his dining hall, given his aversion to flame.
Beyond the bedchamber of a giant lies an artifact only the most powerful of sorcerers can wield. Are you worthy?
Fat little Borr and Rán are great servants, I just wish they'd stay out of the giant's mead!
Reanimated fallen creatures, the Draugr contain the spirits of Hjálmŷr's ancestors , or so he thinks.
I've always liked Rorak, but I feel he is not long for this realm...
Edmond the Red? How about Edmond the Coward? I'd watch your back around that one.
The fighting pit—such a barbaric tradition, but we must allow Hjálmŷr to entertain himself somehow.
The Greataxe of Fury is a prized possession of Hjálmŷr although odd that he rarely fights with it.
Should you end up fighting Hjálmŷr, I'd very much prefer that the Jarl of the Frost Giants keep his head. He has been here so long, this tower really wouldn't be the same without him.
The Everfeeding Serpent... What a gluttonous beast! I've lost count how many adventures it's eaten!
Does Veraetis even worship Khuzza?
Jouslir has sworn himself to the Everfeeding Serpent, even after it ate his hand. That's dedication!
I had high hopes for Tiarsus' band of adventurers, but now only her and Artuk remain. Here's to hoping you don't meet the same fate in the beast's belly!
Artuk looks like he can bend the bars that imprison him... I wonder what he is waiting for?
They say Khuzza is the last hydra.. Good thing I saved it, right?
These Khuzza cultists... They just stand around waiting to be fed to the great beast. Such is the life of a cultist I suppose.
The Mark of the Hydra is tattooed on Jouslir's chest. How do you mortals come up with such creative designs?
I wouldn't walk into any water where you can't see the bottom... Those mutated quippers sure are hungry little fellows.
Where does all the gear from past adventurers end up? I guess that gluttonous lizard is eating it as well?
Acythylass, the Ancient with unending knowledge? Please! None are more knowledgeable than yours truly. I'd put that beast to shame!
Having a few cecaelia about does wonders for decluttering a dungeon floor!
Although weak, Greylythoon is a cunning creature and shouldn't be underestimated.
Snuffbottom the curmudgeon, as I like to call him!
I hope you enjoy swimming...
Do not take the mind of the inhabitant of my basement lightly, mortal; it is nearly as formidable as I am.
The cantankerous little one is incredibly cunning, having survived several of my challenges despite being unremarkable of body. But maybe they will meet their match soon?
Beware any who might follow their own set of rules, for they are as mutable and fickle as the ocean.
I've seens Acythylass penetrate the minds of mortals as easily as it takes its leisurely morning swim!
Don't fight the riptide... It could be your salvation.
Think you'll be the first to survive the tower? That seems unlikely...

entries.name: 1st Floor: Dhugar Bloodsinger
entries.caption: 1st Floor: Dhugar Bloodsinger
rows: Alas, this floor is merely the first test of your mettle. Should you not succeed, I would be greatly disappointed.
It might seem a bit drafty, but this place of yore was once a hidden refuge for those who heeded my words.
Blood rituals are a dangerous first step into the darkness of demonkind.
I wouldn't dare think of jumping from this tower, were I you.
Fighting amidst one's kin - isn't that what brothers are for?
Orcs, like all mortal races, have their quirks, but one should never doubt their indomitable spirit.

entries.name: 2nd Floor: Krul'Thunk
entries.caption: 2nd Floor: Krul'Thunk
rows: Don't these sheep seem a little off to you?
Even the dull and dim witted have their stories. Judge them at your own peril.
The taste of mutton resembles that of mortal man, from what I've been told.
Taste not the ogre's brew, for it could lay waste to even my brethren.
Ware - the loud one is dim-witted but savage; the second only a fool would discount their cunning.
Even the lowliest of sheep has a tale to tell.

entries.name: 3rd Floor: Sryytyl
entries.caption: 3rd Floor: Sryytyl
rows: Wait, are you actually going to drink that purple stuff?
Change of form often takes millennia, yet inhabitants here seem to be able to accelerate it. Fascinating!
The fluids within possess wondrous powers, should you dare to take a sip.
The pulse of giants is a steady thrum of power and life.
Sip not from the lifeblood should you be afraid of change, mortal.
SPIDERS! Burn them with FIRE!

entries.name: 4th Floor: Nephetes
entries.caption: 4th Floor: Nephetes
rows: Go forth with humility on this floor mortals, lest you walk it endlessly.
Swirling sands and rituals of death await you here.
Not all stonework is as it seems.
One of the first inked translations of Inmortui awaits discovery.
These ancient beings believed jackals foresaw omens of the afterlife.
Did... did that wall just move??!

entries.name: 5th Floor: Raz'Drexin
entries.caption: 5th Floor: Raz'Drexin
rows: Beware demonkind. This is one of the last, and therefore most dangerous.
Careful which of the four you choose. Power and peril alike await.
Blue flames are the hallmark of demons. Beware the stench of sulfur as well.
Blood is a powerful gift of the living. Demons thirst for it in endless quantities.
Being subservient to the unholy certainly has its drawbacks...
I think you can trust the druid. Seems a good sort.

entries.name: 6th Floor: Cataclysm Sisters
entries.caption: 6th Floor: Cataclysm Sisters
rows: Nothing here is as it seems. Be on your guard, mortal!
Cute and dangerous are not mutually exclusive concepts.
One would think after millennia they might tire, but hatred is a powerful motivator.
Brambles and thorns and ice and sand and death...my, your visit here will be more than a little amusing.
Could these sisters be any more different?
The body of a penguin, but the heart of a lion!

entries.name: 7th Floor: Hjálmŷr
entries.caption: 7th Floor: Hjálmŷr
rows: The buffoon here sings endlessly of his own exploits. Pity he barely remembers what actually happened.
Warriors test their mettle in a pit of death; the wise avoid such infantile tests of strength.
Flames scorch beards so easily.
Grim dismemberment greets those stupid enough to challenge their host.
The mephits amuse me endlessly - they have such creative ways of sowing chaos within this floor.
I once saw an adventurer try to pet Varsúlfr. Big mistake!

entries.name: 8th Floor: Khuzza
entries.caption: 8th Floor: Khuzza
rows: The great wyrm ever hungers.
Last of its kind, I took pity on it.
Cults are often mere fronts for more nefarious visions.
At least you can expect a quick death - stench of breath, flash of teeth and darkness.
The blade armed one has little patience. Beware the zealot.
I wonder if those bars are quite sturdy? Humidity and iron seldom do well together for prolonged periods of time.

entries.name: 9th Floor: Acythylass
entries.caption: 9th Floor: Acythylass
rows: Go with or against the current - your choice, mortal.
Ichor and slime alike coat my walls....disgusting.
Beware....you are being hunted.
Peril awaits you in deep water... That, and possibly salvation as well.
Caution the offspring that takes after its parent.
I know not where the ebbs and flows of the water leads, but I doubt you could survive it regardless.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the wasteland rhino moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its horn on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage. If the creature is a target, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Impenetrable Hide
entries: The hide of the wasteland rhino is thick and resembles the stone of the wasteland in which it resides, rendering it resistant to acid, cold, and fire damage as well as piercing and slashing damage.

trait.name: Heightened Senses
entries: The wasteland rhino has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Trample
entries: As a bonus action, the wasteland rhino can trample any {@condition prone} targets within 10 feet of it. Any targets within 10 feet of the wasteland rhino must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw made with disadvantage, taking 7 ({@damage 3d4}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Dodge
entries: Using its heightened sense of hearing, once per turn the wasteland rhino can use its reaction to dodge a melee attack that would otherwise hit it.

trait.name: Diminutive
entries: The aldravex can move through spaces occupied by creatures of Small or larger size. Doing so does not trigger attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Oxygenated Blood
entries: If the aldravex takes piercing or slashing damage from a metal weapon, is within 5 feet of a metal object when it takes piercing or slashing damage, or contacts a metal object within 3 turns of taking piercing or slashing damage, its blood causes the metal object to glow red hot. Any creature in physical contact of that object takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage. The effect on the metal object lasts 3 rounds. If a creature is holding or wearing the metal object, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Treasure Hound
entries: The aldravex has advantage on Wisdom (Perception, Survival) checks to detect precious metals, minerals, and gems.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

action.name: Shape Earth (3/Day)
entries: The aldravex can magically move a volume of 10 cubic feet of earth or 5 cubic feet of stone.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dhugar Bloodsinger is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). Dhugar Bloodsinger has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, Dhugar Bloodsinger can move up to his speed toward a hostile creature that he can see.

trait.name: Bloodlust (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Dhugar Bloodsinger can instill an insatiable aggression in an allied creature within 30 feet that can see and hear Dhugar. For the next 3 rounds, the target has advantage on attack rolls, deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage on melee attacks, and deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20. Attack rolls made against the target are made with advantage, and the target has disadvantage on saving throws for the duration.

trait.name: Bloodsong
entries: Any creature within 30 feet of Dhugar Bloodsinger that can hear him can't be {@condition frightened} and has advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Blood Scream (3/Day)
entries: When Dhugar Bloodsinger is hit with a melee attack, he can unleash a bloodcurdling incantation. The attacker must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. Dhugar Bloodsinger gains temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage taken.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Druvok Steelhead is a 3rd-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 10}, {@hit 2} to hit with spell attacks). Druvok Steelhead has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, Druvok Steelhead can move up to his speed toward a hostile creature that he can see.

trait.name: Favored Enemy:
entries: Humans and Dwarves. Druvok Steelhead has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track his favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence (History) checks to recall information about them.

trait.name: Natural Explorer:
entries: Forest. When traveling in forested terrain, Druvok Steelhead's group can't become lost except by magical means, and difficult terrain doesn't slow his group's travel.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Druvok Steelhead makes two longbow attacks or one attack with his battleaxe.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: War Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of Druvok Steelhead's choice that is within 30 feet and can hear him deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20 until the start of Druvok's next turn. Druvok can then make one attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Ancestral Link
entries: The ancestral spirit shares a link with the creature that summoned it while within 60 feet of it. Any damage taken by either the spirit or the summoner is split between both, and the summoner gains advantage on all saving throws and ability checks.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ancestral spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Ghostly Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Vision of the Ancestors
entries: When a creature that can see the ancestral spirit's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of it, the ancestral spirit can force it to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw if the ancestral spirit isn't {@condition incapacitated} and it can see the creature. If the creature fails its save by 5 or more, it is {@condition charmed} by the ancestral spirit. Otherwise, a creature that fails its saving throw is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the disciple of blood can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that they can see.

trait.name: Devoted
entries: The disciple of blood has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blood Sacrifice (1/Day)
entries: The disciple of blood ritualistically wounds itself, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage and spraying a mist of blood around itself a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If a creature fails its save by 5 or more it is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. The disciple of blood and its allies are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc scout can move up to their speed toward a hostile creature that they can see.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc scout makes two handaxe or two javelin attacks.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Paewyn's Luck (3/Day)
entries: If Paewyn Tealeaf fails on a saving throw or skill check that would trigger the effect of a trap, she can reroll the saving throw or skill check.

trait.name: Quick Blades
entries: When Paewyn Tealeaf uses a reaction to make an opportunity attack, she can make a second opportunity attack with disadvantage, but deals critical hit damage if she hits with the second attack.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Paewyn Tealeaf deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally that isn't incapacitated and Paewyn doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Paewyn Tealeaf makes two dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Nimble Dodge
entries: When a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of Paewyn Tealeaf, she can move up to 15 feet in any direction without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Dwarven Resistance
entries: Bhargun Ironfoot has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Stonecunning
entries: Bhargun Ironfoot adds double his Intelligence ability bonus to Intelligence (History) checks when examining stonework and its origins.

trait.name: Survivalist
entries: Bhargun Ironfoot has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Bhargun Ironfoot makes two maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hearty Meal
entries: If the steadholder spends at least 1 hour, it can create a hearty meal. The steadholder and up to six other creatures can partake in the meal, which takes 1 hour to consume. A creature that partakes in the meal becomes resistant to poison damage and has its hit point maximum increased by {@dice 1d10}, and it gains the same number of hit points. These effects last until the creature completes a long rest.

trait.name: Survivalist
entries: The steadholder has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pitchfork
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Krul is a 7th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Bully
entries: Thunk has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks when interacting with creatures whose Charisma ability score is lower than his.

trait.name: Krul's Motes of Fire
entries: Expending a 1st-level spell slot, Krul summons eight (8) tiny motes of intense fire that burst into existence centered on a point within 60 feet of Krul that he can see. Each mote pops in a random 5-foot square within a 30 foot radius of the initial point. Any creature within the same square as the mote must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Krul's Permanent Polymorph
entries: When Krul casts the {@spell polymorph} spell, if the creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more its transformation becomes permanent unless removed with a {@spell dispel magic}, lesser restoration, or similar spell.

trait.name: Krul's Unrefined Fireblast
entries: Expending a 2nd-level spell slot, Krul extends his finger and a small fireblast erupts centered on a point within 60 feet of Krul that he can see. On a successful attack roll, a target within the 5-foot square of the fireblast takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage.
Any target within 5 feet of the initial blast zone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: Krul'Thunk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: When one of Krul'Thunk's heads is asleep, the other head is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Krul'Thunk makes two attacks: one with their spiked club and one with their fist, or one with their spiked club and one spell attack.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spiked Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium sized creature or smaller, it must make a successful {@dc 12} Strength check or be knocked 10 feet in away from Krul'Thunk. If the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more it is also knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk m} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.
Urk, Grum, and Krunk are Ogres and use the  above statblock.

trait.name: Follower
entries: The sheep has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} as well as on Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks.

trait.name: Ruminant Stomach
entries: The sheep has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} if it consumes a contaminated or poisonous substance.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Alyryne Do'Lyl's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 10}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Alyryne Do'Lyl has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Alyryne Do'Lyl can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, Alyryne Do'Lyl knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: Alyryne Do'Lyl ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Alyryne Do'Lyl makes two attacks: one with her bite and one with her claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. The target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If it fails its save by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. It can make a saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Belda Greenbough has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Resilient
entries: Belda Greenbough has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and has resistance to poison damage.
Silver-tongued. Belda Greenbough has advantage on Charisma (Deception, Persuasion) checks when interacting with chaotic- or neutral-aligned creatures.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Belda Greenbough deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally that isn't incapacitated and Belda doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Belda Greenbough makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The broodling can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the broodling knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The broodling ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The broodling swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The broodling swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny broodling. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the broodling swarm knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The broodling swarm ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If it fails its save by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. It can make a saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Spawn Host
entries: The cocooned humanoid are hosts to a growing broodling (75%) or broodling swarm (25%). If they take 1 point of damage the broodling bursts forth from their body and attacks any nearby creature.

trait.name: Weakened
entries: The cocooned humanoid are under the influence of Sryytyl's mutagenic lifeblood. They have disadvantage on all saving throws and ability checks.

action.name: Vomit Mutagen
entries: If a cocooned humanoid is conscious, at the end of each turn it must roll a {@dice d4}. On a roll of 4, it vomits mutagenic lifeblood in a 10-foot cone outward. Any creature within this area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage on a failed save. A creature that takes poison damage must also roll on the Acute Mutagen Exposure table.
Chem, Jashul, and Lorelai are cocooned humanoids and use the above statblock.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The evolved spawn's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 10}, {@hit 2} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The evolved spawn can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the evolved spawn knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The evolved spawn ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The evolved spawn makes two venom burst attacks.

action.name: Venom Burst
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) poison damage. The target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If it fails its save by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. It can make a saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10, 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The mutated humanoid can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense

trait.name: Web Walker

It can make a saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Web Walker

The target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If it fails its save by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. It can make a saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Perkas Greenbough is a 7th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Brave
entries: Perkas Greenbough has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Clever Illusionist (3/Day)
entries: When casting a spell from the illusion school of magic, Perkas Greenbough can create a more realistic illusion. Creatures seeing the illusion make any saving throws against its effect, to perceive it as an illusion, or dispel it with disadvantage.

trait.name: Nimble
entries: Perkas Greenbough can move through the space of any creature that is a Medium or larger size without triggering an attack of opportunity.

trait.name: Resilient
entries: Perkas Greenbough has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and has resistance to poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Perkas Greenbough makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Seldezar D'Lael is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Adept of Necromancy
entries: Seldezar D'Lael is a student of necromancy. Any spells of this school cast by Seldezar that deal necrotic damage to a target deal critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Fire Resistance
entries: Seldezar D'Lael wears a cloak of fire resistance, and is resistant to fire damage.

trait.name: Student of History
entries: Seldezar D'Lael has advantage on Intelligence (History) checks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spawn of Sryytyl can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spawn of Sryytyl knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spawn of Sryytyl ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spawn of Sryytyl makes one bite and one impale attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If it fails its save by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. It can make a saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Impale
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. The target can make a {@dc 11} Strength check at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10, 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sryytyl's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

trait.name: Mutagenic Regeneration
entries: Sryytyl regains 5 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Sryytyl can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, Sryytyl knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: Sryytyl ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sryytyl makes two attacks: one with its bite and one impale attack, or two impale attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Additionally, the target must also roll on the acute mutagen exposure table outlined in that chapter.

action.name: Impale
entries: Sryytyl lunges forward and attempts to impale a single target on her sharp forelimbs. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. The target must make a successful {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be impaled ({@condition restrained}). The creature can make a saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns, breaking free on a success.

legendary.name: Skitter
entries: Sryytyl can move up to 15 feet without triggering attacks of opportunity.

legendary.name: Spawn Broodling
entries: Sryytyl spawns a broodling (75%) or broodling swarm (25%) under her control from within her body.

legendary.name: Mutagen Spray (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Sryytyl sprays mutagen in a 15 foot cone in front of her.Any creature within this cone must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage on a failed save. The creature must also roll on the acute mutagen exposure table outlined in that chapter.

monster.name: Deathless Priest
languages: Inmortui plus languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deathless priest is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The deathless priest has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Ears of the Tomb
entries: The deathless priest has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. It must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} if it takes thunder damage.

trait.name: Eyes of the Undead
entries: The deathless priest can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Ritual Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Baleful Stare
entries: The deathless priest targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the deathless priest, it must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the deathless priest's next turn. If the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Deathless Servant
languages: Inmortui plus languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ears of the Tomb
entries: The deathless servant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. It must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} if it takes thunder damage.

trait.name: Eyes of the Undead
entries: The deathless servant can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deathless servant makes two slam attacks, or one slam attack and uses its Baleful Stare.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Baleful Stare
entries: The deathless servant targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the deathless servant, it must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the deathless servant's next turn. If the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Deathless Warrior
languages: Inmortui plus languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ears of the Tomb
entries: The deathless warrior has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. It must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} if it takes thunder damage.

trait.name: Eyes of the Undead
entries: The deathless warrior can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Turn Defiance
entries: The deathless warrior has advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deathless warrior makes two attacks with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Baleful Stare
entries: The deathless warrior targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the deathless warrior, it must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the deathless warrior's next turn. If the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ill-tempered grout's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells innately, requiring only somatic components:

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ill-tempered grout can move through a space as narrow as 1-inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Creeping Climber
entries: The ill-tempered grout can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Misleading Appearance
entries: While the ill-tempered grout remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a stone wall.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ill-tempered grout makes two attacks with its pseudopod.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 8 ({@damage 2d8 - 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The ill-tempered grout can grapple up to two targets simultaneously.

action.name: Recede
entries: When positioned adjacent to a masonry surface, the ill-tempered grout may recede into the cracks. While receded, the ill-tempered grout has three-quarters cover and becomes immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Additionally, the ill-tempered grout's speed is increased to 25 feet and it regains 5 hit points at the start of each of its turns while receded. If the ill-tempered grout is grappling a creature when it recedes, the creature is freed.

The ill-tempered grout can make a pseudopod attack to end its receded state. If the target is unaware of the ill-tempered grout, the attack is made with advantage and deals critical damage on a hit. Otherwise, the ill-tempered grout can end its receded state as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Oozing Avoidance
entries: If positioned adjacent to a masonry surface and hit with an attack that deals damage, the ill-tempered grout can use its recede ability as a reaction.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Nephetes-em-Xhakar is a 12th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Nephetes-em-Xhakar fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: Nephetes-em-Xhakar gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again within her tomb. The body appears within her sarcophagus, and slumbers until awoken by a living creature.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Nephetes-em-Xhakar is immune to any effect that would turn undead.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. Nephetes-em-Xhakar is healed for half the damage dealt, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw on itself at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Nephetes-em-Xhakar casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Nephetes-em-Xhakar uses her Paralyzing Touch.

legendary.name: Siphon Life (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each living creature within 20 feet of Nephetes-em-Xhakar must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. She is healed for an amount equal to half the damage dealt.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Raquel Saqat is an 8th-level paladin. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Blinding Smite (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Raquel Saqat can infuse his blade with a fury so potent it blinds any creature it strikes. On the next successful melee attack, the target must make a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Righteous Immunity
entries: Raquel Saqat is immune to disease, and has advantage on saving throws made against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Raquel Saqat makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Ears of the Tomb
entries: The withered hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing and smell. It must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} if it takes thunder damage.

trait.name: Eyes of the Undead
entries: The withered hound can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Ravenous
entries: If the withered hound makes a successful bite attack against a target, it can use its bonus action to make a second bite attack against the same target with advantage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sethnal and Talqal are 4th-level spellcasters. Their spellcasting abilty is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). They have the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Ears of the Tomb
entries: Sethnal and Talqal have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. They must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} if they take thunder damage.

trait.name: Eyes of the Undead
entries: Sethnal and Talqal can't use their blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Baleful Stare
entries: The Sethnal or Talqal targets one creature they can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see them, it must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn. If the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.
Sethnal and Talqal are Wizen and use the above statblock.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Arioch Morningstar is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared, which can be cast without material components:

trait.name: Disciplined Mind
entries: Arioch Morningstar has resistance to psychic damage, and has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Nature's Ward
entries: Arioch Morningstar is immune to poison and disease.

trait.name: Wild Shape (2/Day)
entries: Arioch Morningstar can use his action to magically assume the shape of a brown bear,  raven, or wolf. Arioch Morningstar regains expended uses when he finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Arioch Morningstar makes three longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ebon spirit's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The ebon spirit can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ebon spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the ebon spirit has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the ebon spirit can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Ebon Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@dice 1d6 + 2}) psychic  damage. The target must make a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The echo of demonkind's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The echo of demonkind can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The echo of demonkind can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Light Hypersensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the echo of demonkind has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The echo of demonkind has advantage on all saving throws imposed by magical effects.

action.name: Ebon Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) psychic  damage. The target must make a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Possession
entries: One humanoid that the echo of demonkind can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by it. The echo of demonkind then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and takes control of its body. The echo of demonkind now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The echo of demonkind can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts 3 turns, until the body drops to 0 hit points, or until the echo of demonkind ends it as a bonus action. When the possession ends, the echo of demonkind reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and expends three random spell slots if the target has any available once the possession ends.
The target is immune to this Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Garion is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Song of Insanity (3/Day)
entries: Garion can use an action to sing a song (in Abyssal). Any creature within 60 feet of Garion that can hear him must make a successful {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw, coming under the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell on a failed save. If the creature fails its save by 5 or more, it is affected by madness (roll on the Short-Term Madness table).

trait.name: Surrogate of the Devil
entries: Garion's mind has been warped by demonic influence. Garion has disadvantage on all Charisma saving throws and skill checks when interacting with demons. If Garion fails a saving throw or skill check when interacting with a demon, he is {@condition charmed} by the demon and under its control. At the end of each turn Garion may make an additional saving throw, ending the effect but becoming {@condition frightened} of the demon until the end of his next turn. Raz'Drexin may also possess Garion's body at will. If Garion is reduced to 0 hit points while possessed by Raz'Drexin, Raz'Drexin takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage.

While Garion is possessed by Raz'Drexin, he has advantage on all Charisma saving throws and skill checks, gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons, and deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20. Any creature within 60 feet of Garion while he is possessed by Raz'Drexin makes saving throws against any of Garion's spell effects with disadvantage.

trait.name: Tormented Blessing
entries: While Garion is possessed by Raz'Drexin, his AC includes his charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Garion makes three dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Rebuff the Devil
entries: If Garion is possessed by Raz'Drexin and hit with an attack or spell that deals radiant damage, he can make a {@dc 15} Constitution  saving throw. On a success, Garion is free from Raz'Drexin possession, and can't be possessed by Raz'Drexin again until the end of Garion's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Raz'Drexin is an 11th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). Each spell is cast as a 5th-level spell, and Raz'Drexin regains their expended spell slots when they finish a short or long rest. Raz'Drexin knows the following spells:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Raz'Drexin can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Raz'Drexin takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Light Hypersensitivity
entries: While in bright light, Raz'Drexin has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Raz'Drexin makes two ebon touch attacks, or one attack with its tendrils of darkness.

action.name: Ebon Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@dice 2d6 + 5}) psychic  damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Tendrils of Darkness
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) necrotic damage. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Possession
entries: One Humanoid that Raz'Drexin can see within 5 ft. of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by Raz'Drexin; Raz'Drexin then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. Raz'Drexin now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. Raz'Drexin can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and Raz'Drexin retains its Alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, until Raz'Drexin ends it as a bonus action, or Raz'Drexin is forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, Raz'Drexin reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and expends its three highest spell slots if it has spell slots once the possession ends.
The target is immune to this Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.
Raz'Drexin can possess Garion at will, requiring no action. Garion automatically fails the saving throw to avoid being possessed by Raz'Drexin.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Avilnar is an 11th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks. Avilnar has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: Creatures have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws while attempting to pierce Avilnar's illusions, and she can use her sneak attack ability while disguised within an illusion.

trait.name: Cunning and Manipulative
entries: Avilnar has advantage on Charisma (Deception, Performance, Persuasion) checks when interacting with intelligent creatures of lawful or chaotic alignments.

trait.name: Free Mind
entries: Avilnar is immune to being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and has resistance to psychic damage. She also has advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks to detect illusions.

trait.name: Keen Observer
entries: Avilnar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while observing other creatures' behaviors.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Avilnar deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally that isn't incapacitated and Avilnar doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Avilnar makes four attacks with her daggers.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Faradel is an 11th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks. Faradel has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Chaotic Mind
entries: Faradel has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation, Persuasion) checks when interacting with chaotic-aligned creatures.

trait.name: Necromantic Power
entries: Faradel deals critical damage on spell attack rolls of 19 or 20 on spells cast from the school of necromancy.

trait.name: Undead Affinity
entries: An undead creature within 30 feet of Faradel deals critical damage on attack rolls of 19 or 20 and has advantage on saving throws made against the turn undead ability.

trait.name: Weapon of the Damned
entries: Faradel wields a sickle of pure necrotic energy that dissipates if she is reduced to 0 hit points. It can be summoned into existence or dismissed as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Faradel makes two attacks with her sickle of the damned.

action.name: Sickle of the Damned
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Giant Form
entries: As a bonus action, Flipper can grow to a Large size for 1 minute. While in this giant form, he deals additional damage (see below) and has advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: Any creature {@condition grappled} by Flipper takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage at the start of their turn. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Flipper while in giant form they make Strength checks to break free with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Flipper makes two attacks with his flippers.

action.name: Flipper
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage ({@dice 2d8 + 5} if in giant form). If the target is a creature they must make a Strength saving throw or become {@condition grappled}. Flipper cannot make any attacks while grappling a target.

reaction.name: Flipper Smack
entries: If an enemy triggers an opportunity attack while Flipper is in giant form and takes damage as the result of this attack, their movement speed becomes 0 and they are {@condition stunned} until the start of their next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kyreen is a 12th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: Any friendly creature within 30 feet of Kyreen has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and gains a +1 bonus to their armor class while Kyreen is conscious.

trait.name: Disciple of Order
entries: Kyreen has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. She also has advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks when interacting with lawful-aligned creatures, but disadvantage on Charisma (Deception) checks when interacting with chaotic-aligned creatures.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When Kyreen hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, she can expend one spell slot to deal an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@damage 1d8} radiant damage for each spell slot higher than 1st.

trait.name: Radiant Power
entries: Kyreen deals critical damage on spell or melee attack rolls of 19 or 20 on that deal radiant damage.

trait.name: Turn Unholy
entries: Kyreen brandishes her holy symbol and speaks a prayer against undead. Each undead creature within 30 feet that can see or hear her must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails its saving throw it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kryeen makes three attacks with her warhammer of radiance.

action.name: Maul of Radiance
